data.title: Who is Danielle Smith's husband and what is their restaurant?
data.meta_description: DANIELLE Smith has been one of the leading politicians in Canada since she made a comeback in 2022 - but this isn't her only skill.The United Conserva
data.text:
DANIELLE Smith has been one of the leading politicians in Canada since she made a comeback in 2022 - but this isn't her only skill.

The United Conservative Party leader has also turned her hand at restaurant owning and runs a quirky diner with her spouse David Moretta.

Who is Danielle Smith?

Danielle Smith is the leader of the United Conservative Party of Canada.

She was born in Calgary on April 1, 1971, and was the second of five children who lived together in subsidised housing.

Danielle worked the odd job as a TV extra and also had a stint at McDonald's before she gained a degree in English and Economics at the local university.

The ambitious woman kick-started her career working as a columnist before she went on to host her own radio show which was focused on health policy and property rights.

When did Danielle Smith come into power?

The Canadian entered into the world of politics in 2006 when she supported Progressive Conservative member Ted Morton in his leadership campaign, before she quit to join the Wildrose Alliance in 2009.

As the Wildrose leader she lost the Alberta election in 2012, as well as subsequent by-elections.

In December 2014, she rejoined the Progressive Conservative Party.

The Progressive Conservative Association of Alberta and the Wildrose Party merged to form the United Conservative Party in 2017.

She worked in politics up to 2015, when she took a break to have a career in media and radio - which she did for seven years until making a comeback in 2022.

Danielle's return to politics was dubbed by CBC as "one of the most remarkable political comebacks in Canadian history".

However the politician has experienced bumps in the career road and was criticised by a desmog reporter for making "several misleading statements" regarding fossil fuel.

Who is Danielle Smith's husband David Moretta?

David Moretta is Danielle's second husband - who she met when she was working in radio as he was an executive producer.

The couple have been together for more than 15 years and were married in 2006.

They don't have children but have a small fluffy dog named Boot who features on Danielle's Twitter page.

Whilst his wife runs the UCP, David spends his time running several businesses, one of which is a small restaurant which he co-owns with Danielle.

What is Danielle's Smith's restaurant?

Despite having busy lives, Danielle and her husband manage to find enough time to run a restaurant.

The pair own a popular caf√© called The Dining Car which is a cosy spot located in High River, Canada.

The UCP leader is known to put in the occasional waitress shift at her restaurant and can be seen beaming whilst washing dishes in a snap shared on Twitter.

Danielle captioned the post: "Fun fact: my husband and I still own a restaurant.

"This weekend the dishwasher broke down, so I went in for a shift."

The restaurant serves a range of traditional dishes from burgers to pecan pie and has received many five star reviews.
